items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the balls of your feet on a raised surface such as a step or block.
Hold onto a stable surface such as a wall or railing for balance.
Slowly raise your heels off the ground as high as you can, keeping your legs straight.
Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your calf muscles.
Lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Targets the soleus muscle in the calf, which is important for ankle stability and balance
Can be done with minimal equipment, making it a convenient exercise to do at home or while traveling
Helps to improve overall calf strength and size
Can be easily modified by adding weight or changing the angle of the foot placement
May help to prevent injuries such as ankle sprains by strengthening the muscles around the ankle joint
